OpenFlow.NBAPI
Class ControllerContext

java.lang.Object
  OpenFlow.NBAPI.ControllerContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.openflow.northboundapi.util.NBAPICommonConstants
public class ControllerContext
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.openflow.northboundapi.util.NBAPICommonConstants

Connection context for northbound API access to SDN controller.

The ControllerContext holds connection context data for access to an SDN controller through the northbound API protocol. When directed to make a connection, it uses the context data to establish the connection and perform the northbound API login protocol, which may include authentication.

On receipt of the server's welcome message, some context parameters (e.g., server's queue policy) will be updated to reflect the server's actual settings. These server-updated settings will persist after the connection has been terminated. If no connection exists for such parameters when a set-value method is called, the context's value is updated immediately. If an established connection exists, a set-value method will (asynchronously) issue an appropriate request to the server and the context values will be updated once the response is received from the server. Thus, the get-value methods will only return the last known server state and not the most recently requested values (if a disconnect occurs before the response is received, the requested values are lost).

Once the server's welcome message is received, the context will enter the Initializing state, where any server exchanges required by context-retained settings (determining extension function lists, SwitchStatus selection, ReceiveMessage and packet-in MatchFilter requests) are handled.

When a server connection to a controller terminates, any messages remaining in the queue to be sent are discarded. However, messages in the received queue will persist until either explicitly cleared or a server connection parameter is changed (i.e., destination server address, SSL context, or client (login) identifier).

Implementation note: It is recommended that a context instance be used for a single server, using new instances for each destination server even when different server connections are not intended to be used simultaneously. This approach minimizes the parameter drift and resynchronization when transitioning from one server to another.

The following table lists the configuration parameters used by the setFromParameters() method:

Configuration Parameter Name Data Type Default Description
"ARPSourceLinkAddr" ethernet address FE:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF The link-layer address to use as the source address in ARP request packets.

CAUTION: the value of the source MAC address should be chosen such that the reply packet will pass through the managed switch and will not have a flow-rule match. While the switch's datapath ID conforms to these requirements, the switch is likely to consume such a packet rather than forward it to the controller. It has also been observed that some (downstream) switches may filter certain MAC addresses (e.g., those with the ethernet broadcast bit set).

"ARPSupressTime" integer milliseconds 5000 The time interval within which any further ARP requests are suppressed and only the local host-information cache is consulted. Default is from org.openflow.northboundapi.util.ARPSuppressEntry.DefaultARPSuppressTime.
"BufferSizeInput" integer bytes 10240 The input buffer size for data recievd from the northbound API controller connection. This parameter limits the size of northbound API (GPB) messages that can be decoded.
"BufferSizeOutput" integer bytes 10240 The output buffer size for data sent over the northbound API controller connection. This parameter limits the size of northbound API (GPB) messages that can be encoded.
"ControllerAddress" string "localhost" ":" "29979" or "34029" The socket address of the northbound API server. If an SSL context is provided, the default (SSL) port will be 34029 otherwise, the default (plain socket) port will be 29979 for the northbound API OpenFlow controller connection.
"ClientID" string "guest" The default "user name" to use to authenticate the northbound API controller connection. Typically this string will appear as one of the "members" in the northbound API configuration file "SEGroup.json" (otherwise, default privileges are used).
"DefaultTimeout" integer milliseconds 120000 The default timeout to use when making requests of the northbound API controller.
"HostEntryTTL" integer milliseconds 1200000L The default longevity of a host-information entry in the local cache.
"HostEntryTTL" integer milliseconds 1200000L The default longevity (time-to-live) of a host-information entry in the local cache.
"HostLearnFromPktIn" boolean false Determines if host-information entries in the local cache should be populated from all packet-in messages received from the controller (if disabled, host-information entries will only be populated by controller queries and received ARP packets).
"NoMatchPktIn" boolean false Registers to recieve all "no-match" (no flow-table rule matches the packet, controller receives it to determine the disposition). Can aid in population of host-information entries in the local cache when used with "HostLearnFromPktIn" enabled.
"PingReplyOn" boolean true Allows the context to respond to ping requests from the northbound API server.
"VersionNB" integer 0L Protocol version for the northbound API server.
"VersionSB" integer 0L Protocol version for the SB (OpenFlow) protocol used by the northbound API server.
"SSLIdentityPath" file path None. File path containing SSL identity information (certificate) to use when connecting to the northbound API server.
"SSLIdentityPwd" string None. Password to SSL identity information (certificate).
"SSLTrustPath" file path None. File path containing SSL trust information (certificate) to use when connecting to the northbound API server.
"SSLProtocol" string "TLS" SSL protocol to use.
"XIDListCount" integer 32 Number of XID values to request from the northbound API server at one time (reduces number of round-trip requests to the server to obtain XID values).
"XIDListStale" integer milliseconds 3600000L Length of time before unused XID values previously requested from the northbound API server are considered stale and a new batch must be requested.

getControllerAddress

public java.net.InetSocketAddress getControllerAddress()
Get target northbound-API controller service address.

Returns:
null if not set; otherwise address of target controller service.

setControllerAddress

public boolean setControllerAddress(java.net.InetSocketAddress new_address)
Set target northbound-API controller service address.

A new target service address may not be set if an established connection exists or is being opened.

Returns:
true if target service address was set.

setControllerAddress

public boolean setControllerAddress(java.lang.String address_spec)
Set target northbound-API controller service via string specification.

Format of the string specification is "[host][':'port]" If not specified, host will default to DefaultNBServerHost and port will default to DefaultNBServerPort if no SSL context has been established or DefaultNBServerPortSSL of an SSL context has been established. Leading and trailing whitespace for each syntactic element will be ignored.

getDefaultPort

public int getDefaultPort()
Gets the default port based on if SSL context set or not.

null if not set; otherwise SSL context for target controller service connection.

Set SSL context for northbound-API controller service connection.

A new context may not be set if an established connection exists or is being opened.

Returns:
true if target service SSL context was set.

getClientID

public java.lang.String getClientID()
Get the context's login identity.

setClientID

public boolean setClientID(java.lang.String new_value)
Set the context's login identity (and reset its authentication data).

The client ID may only be set when the context is not connected (i.e., the login name can not be changed while logged in). The new client ID string will be trimmed and must not be empty or null.

Returns:
true if the client ID has actually been changed to something new.

getBufferSizeInput

public int getBufferSizeInput()
Get the context's input buffer size parameter.

setBufferSizeInput

public void setBufferSizeInput(int new_value)
Set the context's input buffer size parameter.

This positive-valued parameter is only used when a connection to the controller is established. Changing the parameter after the connection's input sream has been created will have no effect on the current connection's input operations.

getBufferSizeOutput

public int getBufferSizeOutput()
Get the context's output buffer size parameter.

setBufferSizeOutput

public void setBufferSizeOutput(int new_value)
Set the context's output buffer size parameter.

This positive-valued parameter is only used when a connection to the controller is established. Changing the parameter after the connection's output sream has been created will have no effect on the current connection's output operations.

getDefaultTimeout

public int getDefaultTimeout()
Get the context's default timeout value.

setDefaultTimeout

public void setDefaultTimeout(int new_value)
Set the context's default timeout value.

The default timeout value is used when no timeout value has been provided for an operation that may time out (e.g., waiting for a server response) and no operation tracking object has been returned. For example, this timeout value is used to limit the time spent in any given protocol exchange conducted during the Initializing phase of connection establishment.

getPingReplyOn

public boolean getPingReplyOn()
Get the context's ping-reply value.

setPingReplyOn

public void setPingReplyOn(boolean new_value)
Set the context's ping-reply value.

If ping-reply is enabled (set true), the client will respond to an internal NB protocol ping request from the controller (NB server) by sending back a ping reply with a matching sequence number. Otherwise, the server request is ignored. This setting has no impact on client ping requests sent to the controller.

getHostLearnFromPktIn

public boolean getHostLearnFromPktIn()
Get the context's learn host-info from PACKET-IN value.

setHostLearnFromPktIn

public void setHostLearnFromPktIn(boolean new_value)
Set the context's learn host-info from PACKET-IN value.

If learn host-info from PACKET-IN is enabled (set true), the client will learn host-info data from all received PACKET-IN messages (with valid IP addresses). Specifically, the packet source data, which includes the IP address, MAC (link-layer) address, and switch-port of the source, will be used.

getNoMatchPktIn

public boolean getNoMatchPktIn()
Get the context's no-match PACKET-IN value.

setNoMatchPktIn

public void setNoMatchPktIn(boolean new_value)
Set the context's no-match PACKET-IN value.

If no-match PACKET-IN is enabled (set true), the client will register to receive all PACKET-IN messages from the controller that have the reason code set to NO_MATCH (meaning switch had no flow modification rule for the packet). This enables the client to see (and learn from -- see the setHostLearnFromPktIn() method) the same data as the learing switch module in the controller.

getQueueReceiveEnable

public boolean getQueueReceiveEnable()
Get the context's queue-receive enable value.

setQueueReceiveEnable

public void setQueueReceiveEnable(boolean new_value)
Set the context's queue-receive enable value.

If queue-receive is enabled (set true), the client will place any messages not directly handled by the context nor covered by an explicit call-back into the message queue.

getHostEntryExpires

getServerQueuePolicy

public NBServerQueuePolicy getServerQueuePolicy()
Get the server message queuing policy.

When in a connected state, attempts to change the server message queuing policy will result in a request message to the server and the state of the policy object will be updated when the response is received. Thus, while connected, fetches of queuing policy state will reflect server-mitigated values.

When not in a connected state, changes to the server message queuing policy are immediately retained in the policy object and are initially requested in the client's hello message.

registerExtension

public boolean registerExtension(java.lang.String name,
                                 ControllerContext.InternalExtension extension)
Register an NB internal protocol extension.

This call registers an extension handler for the named internal NB protocol extension (not to be confused with the controller extension protocol). The internal NB protocol extensions are meant to handle NB connection-related configuration exchanges, and extensions supported by the server will be listed in the "internalExtensionIDs" member of the server welcome message.

getARPSupressTime

public int getARPSupressTime()
Get the ARP suppression time (in milliseconds).

setARPSupressTime

public void setARPSupressTime(int value)
Set the ARP suppression time (in milliseconds).

The ARP suppression time attempts to restrict the client from requesting ARPs (or server ControllerSupport/GetIPAddrInfo) too frequently for a given switch, switch-port, and IP-address combination. A redundant call within the specified time period will be suppressed and only the local cache will be consulted.

Parameters:
value - if greater than zero, value is used; otherwise default is set

getXIDListCount

public int getXIDListCount()
Get the XID cache length.

setXIDListCount

public void setXIDListCount(int value)
Set the XID cache length.

The XID cache length is used by the getNextXID(SwitchInfo,long) method to determine the number of transaction identifiers (XIDs) to request at one time from the controller for a given switch. The cache is used to minimize the number of round-trip requests made to the controller. The transaction identifiers are used to uniquely identify requests sent to the switch.

WARNING: This value should not be set larger than any limit the controller places on the number of transaction identifiers that may be requested at one time.

getXIDListStale

public long getXIDListStale()
Get the XID cache stale time (in milliseconds).

setXIDListStale

public void setXIDListStale(long value)
Set the XID cache stale time (in milliseconds).

The XID cache stale time is used by the getNextXID(SwitchInfo,long) method to determine if the cached transaction identifiers (XIDs) are too stale for use and therefor a new request to the controller must be issued. The cache is used to minimize the number of round-trip requests made to the controller. The transaction identifiers are used to uniquely identify requests sent to the switch. Transaction identifiers issued by the controller are not reserverd and so use of the cached entries may collide with "current" transaction identifiers if left too long. A value of zero means cache entries will not be considered stale. The expiration of a cached XID list is determined at the time the list is fetched from the controller (i.e., setting this value has no effect on existing cached values).

getSwitchStatusSelect

public org.openflow.northboundapi.util.ProtoUtil.SwitchStatusSelect getSwitchStatusSelect()
Get the switch info status selection.

isSwitchStatusSelected

public boolean isSwitchStatusSelected()
Are switch info updates selected.

getSwitchStatusSelectTimeout

public long getSwitchStatusSelectTimeout()
Get the switch info status selection timeout.

setSwitchStatusSelect

public boolean setSwitchStatusSelect(org.openflow.northboundapi.util.ProtoUtil.SwitchStatusSelect selection,
                                     long timeout)
Enable or disable automatic switch info status management.

When not connected to a controller, the new setting will be retained and, if selection is not null, a control service request for switch status will be issued after the welcome message is received on each subsequent controller connection. The last timeout value seen will be applied when the call is made on the new connection.

When connected to a controller, this method will block until the reply from the switch status (northbound control service) request is received. This method will also block while any other thread is blocked in this method waiting for a switch status control service reply (only one active request at a time). The timeout will apply to the aggregate of both blocking conditions (i.e., timeout clock begins at method invocation).

If selection matches the current selection, no action is taken (returns true). Otherwise one of the following actions is taken:

  • If selection is null, the local list is left unmodified and any request to the controller does not set the value field, indicating that the server is not to deliver any further SWITCH_STATUS messages.
  • If selection is "ADDED" or "REMOVED" then a request to the controller is issued selecting for both "ADDED" and "REMOVED" switch status messages. If the prior selection was null, the local switch list is cleared before any request is issued.
  • If selection is "PORT_CHANGED" then a request to the controller is issued selecting for "ADDED", "REMOVED", and "PORT_CHANGED" switch status messages. If the prior selection was null, the local switch list is cleared before the request is issued.

Parameters:
selection - switch status message selection criteria
timeout - maximum time, in milliseconds, to wait for a reply from the server. Zero waits indefinitely.
Returns:
true if selection is set, including if context's selection value was not changed. Will return false if there is an active controller connection and the reply is not received within the specified timeout.

queryHostInfo

public HostInfoList queryHostInfo(java.net.InetAddress host)
Get link-layer information for IP host address from controller.

queryHostInfo

public HostInfoList queryHostInfo(java.net.InetAddress host,
                                  SwitchInfo switch_info)
Get link-layer information for IP host address from controller.

queryHostInfo

public HostInfoList queryHostInfo(java.net.InetAddress host,
                                  int arp_time)
Get link-layer information for IP host address from controller.

queryHostInfo

public HostInfoList queryHostInfo(java.net.InetAddress host,
                                  SwitchInfo switch_info,
                                  java.lang.Integer switchPort,
                                  java.lang.Integer excludePort,
                                  int arp_time,
                                  long timeout,
                                  HostInfoList list)
Get link-layer information for (IPv4) host address by active query.

Each call to this method will (re)activate listening for the ARP reply packets to update the local cache.

If the connected controller supports the "ControllerSupport" extension, then the "GetIPAddrInfo" request will be used to perform an active query. If arp_time is greater than zero, the "GetIPAddrInfo" request will wait at least this long after the most recent ARP before returning the relevant data from the controller's device cache. When this extension is used, the SwitchInfo table may be empty when this method is called. If the switch_info parameter is null, the controller will use the current list of managed switches and the SwitchInfo table will be updated as new datapath IDs are received (note that the switch port information will be missing from the SwitchInfo table for entries added this way).

If the connected controller does not support the "ControllerSupport" extension and arp_time is greater than zero, then the context will attempt to send ARP messages and wait the specified time before performing the lookup from the local cache. If the switch_info parameter is null, the SwitchInfo table must contain at least one entry or the operation will terminate without consulting the local cache.

Parameters:
host - the (IPv4) host address to seek link-layer information.
switch_info - if null, all known switches will be tried.
switchPort - physical switch port. If not null and switch_info is not null, only entries matching this switch port will be returned and ARP requests will only be sent to this switch port.
excludePort - exclusion physical switch port. If not null and switch_info is not null, entries matching this switch port will not be returned and ARP requests will not be sent to this switch port.
arp_time - if greater than zero, minimum time (in milliseconds) to wait after (most recently) sent ARP before the local cache is queried for matching data.
timeout - time limit, in milliseconds, to spend blocked in this call (or, if over ExpirationDeltaMaximum, the absolute sunset time). Less than or equal to zero waits getDefaultTimeout() milliseconds.
list - the list to use to add matching HostInfo entries. If null, a new list is created if any entries are to be returned.
